title: CSS Borders
info: Usning CSS, it's possible to set borders around HTML elements. With CSS border properties you can modify the style, the width, and even the color of a border.

mcQuestions.question: Which CSS attribute can be used to set border color?
mcQuestions.explanation: Remember, use the border-color CSS attribute to set border color!

mcQuestions.question: Which CSS attribute is used to set the border style?
mcQuestions.explanation: Remember, use the border-style CSS attribute to set the border style!

mcQuestions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid border style?
mcQuestions.explanation: Valid border styles include dotted, dashed, solid, double, groove, ride, inset, none, and hidden. Not linear!
